full_summary:
#Salish Sea Plankton Survey – Multi-Day Vessel Charter
========================================

**Solicitation Reference:** cb-979-90621002

**Publication Date:** January 3, 2024

**Tender Closing Date:** January 19, 2024, 2:00 PM AST

### Background

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada intends to conduct a biological and physical oceanographic survey of the Strait of Georgia, Salish Sea. The survey will involve collecting plankton and oceanographic data at up to 30 stations.

### Objective

The selected contractor will provide a suitable vessel with a crane or A-frame and winch to conduct biologicaI (vertical plankton hauls) and physical oceanographic (CTD and water sampling) monitoring. The contractor will also provide accommodations and workspace for a minimum of two science crew members.

### Requirements

* Conduct up to 30 plankton net casts;
* Perform CTD casts in the Salish Sea;
* Collect water samples at select depths using Niskin bottles or a mini-Rosette system;
* Transit to and from up to 30 oceanographic stations throughout the Strait of Georgia;
* Provide a safe and comfortable working environment for the science crew.

### Procurement Details

* **Procurement Category:** SRV (Services)
* **Notice Type:** Request for Proposal
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding
* **Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price
* **Trade Agreements:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* **Regions:** Canada, with a focus on British Columbia

### Contact Information

* **Point of Contact:** Cal LaKing
* **Email:** DFO.Tenders-Soumissions.MPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca
* **Phone:** (506) 478-3581

### Notice Attachments

The Notice of Proposed Procurement (NPP) can be found at the following links:

* English: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/28602/30004493a---rfp.pdf
* French: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/28602/30004493a---rfp-_fr.pdf

Please note that the previous bid solicitation number 30004493, dated October 20th, 2023, with a closing of November 6th, 2023 at 2:00 PM AST has been cancelled
